title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and styled with CSS, showcasing a modern and efficient development workflow. Leveraging React Query for data fetching and MUI for a polished user interface, this repository serves as a practical example for building robust and scalable web applications. It explores key topics such as project structure, component design, and effective data management within a Next.js environment.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: Robofleet-dashboard is a web-based monitoring and control interface for robotic fleets, built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS. This project provides a user-friendly dashboard for visualizing robot telemetry, managing tasks, and interacting with robots in real-time. Focused on simplifying robot fleet management, this project leverages common web technologies to create an accessible and efficient platform for project development and deployment.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: crud-expense-tracker is a simple web application built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, utilizing Material-UI for a clean and responsive user interface. This project demonstrates fundamental CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for managing and tracking personal expenses. It provides a practical example of implementing a functional expense tracker with modern web development techniques.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, aiming to [replace with a brief description of the project's core function, e.g., "provide a modern and efficient task management solution" or "explore advanced data visualization techniques"]. This repository showcases [mention key functionalities or features, e.g., "a modular architecture and interactive user interface" or "real-time data streaming and customizable dashboards"] and serves as a learning ground for applying best practices in modern web development.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It demonstrates best practices in building server-rendered React applications, focusing on clean architecture, component reusability, and efficient data fetching. This repository serves as a learning resource and a starting point for developers looking to build robust and scalable dashboard interfaces.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, designed to help users visualize and manage their accumulated sleep debt. This application allows users to input their sleep schedule and desired sleep hours to calculate and track their sleep deficit over time, providing a simple and effective way to improve sleep habits. This project demonstrates the use of TypeScript in a practical application.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project management application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help users organize and visualize their ideas and projects in a flexible, intuitive board. Inspired by Kanban methodologies, the application allows for easy drag-and-drop functionality, custom card creation, and progress tracking, enabling effective workflow management and collaboration.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the LaTeX source code and generated HTML output for my resume. Utilizing TeX for professional typesetting and HTML for online accessibility, this project showcases my skills and experience in a clean and easily distributable format. It serves as a continuously updated digital resume.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript designed to provide a simple and efficient platform for creating and participating in polls and voting systems. This project focuses on delivering a user-friendly experience for managing and engaging with voting initiatives, serving as a practical example of modern web development principles and best practices within the project category.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed as a project to demonstrate proficiency in creating dynamic web applications. This repository showcases a functional application implementing basic create, read, update, and delete operations, offering a practical example of integrating a Python backend with a relational database and a user-friendly frontend.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This GitHub repository, built with HTML and Python, is a project focused on map visualization. It explores techniques for presenting geographical data and insights through interactive and visually appealing map interfaces. The project utilizes Python for data processing and HTML for front-end rendering, aiming to provide a clear and engaging way to understand spatial information.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, utilizing Express.js for the backend and Vite.js for a fast frontend development experience. The project leverages the Gemini API to provide insightful and engaging conversations, exploring topics related to AI and potentially other domains. The frontend is crafted with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, offering a user-friendly interface for interacting with the Gemini API powered conversational engine.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains a collection of finance-related projects and tutorials. Focusing on practical application, it explores topics such as stock analysis, portfolio optimization, and financial modeling, aiming to provide hands-on experience in using Python for financial data analysis and decision-making.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a dynamic web project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on creating an interactive and engaging user experience. This repository showcases a practical application of modern web development technologies, demonstrating skills in front-end architecture and user interface design. It serves as a personal project illustrating proficiency in building robust and well-structured web applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a modern web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS, designed for real-time monitoring and management of IoT-connected assets. Leveraging Supabase for backend services, this project provides a user-friendly interface for tracking asset location, status, and other key metrics. The repository showcases a practical implementation of a full-stack solution for IoT asset tracking, demonstrating best practices in TypeScript development and modern web UI design.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a project showcasing a customizable and interactive event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository provides a foundation for creating visually appealing and dynamically updating calendars for displaying events, appointments, or important dates, allowing users to easily manage and visualize their schedules. It serves as a practical example for learning front-end development and exploring calendar implementation techniques.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and displaying log data to facilitate debugging and understanding of ROS-based systems.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully functional e-commerce web application built using Next.js 14 with the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React Query for efficient data fetching and management. This project leverages Material-UI (MUI) for a polished and responsive user interface, demonstrating best practices for building type-safe and scalable e-commerce solutions. It showcases key concepts related to e-commerce development, front-end architecture, and modern web technologies.
